definition: variant of 聽|听[ting1]/to hear/to obey

sentences.english: Even when something does't soud right, I'm willing to hear your out.
sentences.chinese: 即時好像不太有道理，我也願意聼你進一步解釋。

sentences.english: Put on headphones, listen to sad music.
sentences.chinese: 戴上耳機，聼聼那傷感的音樂。

sentences.english: Put on headphones, listen to sad music.
sentences.chinese: 戴上耳機，聼聼那傷感的音樂。

sentences.english: Can you read it to me in Chinese?
sentences.chinese: 你能用中文念給我聼嗎？

sentences.english: Listening to the words to songs that you never bothered listening to before.
sentences.chinese: 聼那些你以前從不願爲此枉費工夫的歌詞。

sentences.english: You are the most attractive man I ever laid ears.
sentences.chinese: 你是我聼過的最帥的男士。

sentences.english: All people want is someone to listen.
sentences.chinese: 人總是希望有其他人聆聼自己。

sentences.english: I will memorize funny stories I've heard and tell them to you.
sentences.chinese: 我會把別處聼來的好笑話記住，回家悄悄講給你聼。

sentences.english: I will memorize funny stories I've heard and tell them to you.
sentences.chinese: 我會把別處聼來的好笑話記住，回家悄悄講給你聼。

definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
to attend a meeting (and hear what is discussed)
